availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Horace Wintersmith (Hardin Co, KY, asst tax assessor, possible notary public)

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of Horace Gates Wintersmith and Margaret F. Wintersmith Wintersmith. Married to Sarah "Sallie" Elizabeth Metcalfe Wintersmith in Hardin County, Kentucky, on January 13, 1860. Father of Joseph Wintersmith and Theodore Wintersmith. Student in Hardin County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Hardin County in 1850. Resident of Hardin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 1, p. 57B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 1, p. 275.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 3, p. 92.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 11, p. 479A.
"Charles Horace Wintersmith (1836-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial #12101971, accessed January 4, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/12101971.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, 1793-1862, Film #000390788.
